intro: Cynoglossospermum omphaloides, commonly known as the star-tongue plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
